pros: Lovely people and helping a good cause

job_title: Veterinary Liaison C-ordinator in Midhurst, England
pros:
Genuinely making a difference to our partners lives.
The care and consideration to dog welfare and health.
Flexitime to allow for a better work/ life balance and a trusting nature with your manager to organise your own workload/time.
Bringing my dog to work.
The location of the center allowing beautiful dog walks in the woods at lunch.
cons:
Due to the nature of the Charity there are a lot of remote workers that we don't get as much direct, face to face contact with when in the office. However there are regular learning days for specific teams as well as more recently team building days to attend in order to combat this. 

It is a very busy and growing Charity which means each and every job role has a large workload. For some this can be overwhelming and for others this would actually be a pro as they like to be busy.

review_title: An honest review of Canine Partners
pros: Canine Partners (CP) is a great place to work, I’ve been here just over four years and it’s certainly one of the best places I have ever worked. The vision of the charity is really clear and everyone is incredibly passionate about making a difference. There is a great team spirit at CP and the offices have a fun but hardworking atmosphere. The staff are all really friendly and the managers are encouraging and supportive. Of course the dogs at CP are the real stars of the show and it’s great to see them training around the centres and coming up to the office for the occasional cuddle. CP offers fantastic perks through a reward and recognition platform and both centres are in beautiful locations.
cons: As with any job there are highs and lows but lows at CP are thankfully few and far between. Some of the technology is a bit behind the times, particularly for fundraising, and parking at the Southern Centre can be a pain in the winter months as the field gets boggy but otherwise it’s a pretty awesome or should I say ‘pawsome’ place to work!

review_title: •	Supporting and liaising with the Midlands, North and Scotland Volunteer Community Groups and Community Champions.
job_title: Community Fundraising Assistant (Midlands, North and Scotland) in Loughborough, England
pros: Supporting an incredible Charity that is helping to transform lives of so many people in the world.
cons: The role is very faced paced.

job_title: Website and Social Media Coordinator in Midhurst, England
pros: A great charity to work for - people care about the partnerships so they work hard and collaborate together
cons: Not really any room for progression due to size of charity.
